Event: thinks someone may have keyed her car.  Big scratches on the hood.
Post:
"I'm so upset, I just found out that my car has been keyed. The scratches on the hood are huge and it's clear that someone did this intentionally. It's really frustrating because I've always tried to keep my car in good condition. I guess some people just have it out for me and want to see me fail. It's really discouraging."

This post exhibits a stable attributional style because it attributes the cause of the scratches on the car to a personal failing or malice, rather than to external factors such as an accident or a random act of vandalism. By assuming that someone intentionally keyed the car and that this is a reflection of their own failings, the author is exhibiting a stable attributional style.
